author: Christa Dao
title: Thousands come out for return of Waskimo in Regina - Regina | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 20, 2017 6:43 pm Updated: February 20, 2017 7:17 pm Thousands come out for return of Waskimo in Regina By Christa Dao Reporter Global News 
WATCH ABOVE: It's a Family Day for the record books. Waskimo, the winter festival,was back and better than ever. Christa Dao has more on the successful return. What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
Organizers are heralding the return of Waskimo a success as more than 5,000 people came out for the winter festival. 
“The number of corporate sponsors that have stepped up to help fund this event, that’s a good measurement as well, and the traction that we had on social media too,” Jim Aho, Waskimo festival producer, said. . @WaskimoRegina picking up speed, everyone and their dog is here. #yqr pic.twitter.com/etFqE9H3SL 
— Christa Dao (@ChristaDao) February 20, 2017 
One of the major draws of the festival was the “Outhouse Races,” where teams raced against each other, pushing a porta-potty down the ice. 
The first place winner, Team Escape Manor proved victorious, receiving the “Golden Plunger” award for their efforts. 
“I don’t think there’s practicing for an outhouse race, I don’t know what to say. It’s amazing. All these years of sitting on the toilet, really comes together,” Shaun Hesse of Team Escape Manor/Jaleta Pacers laughed. ICYMI: @WaskimoRegina ho-lympics, @EscapeManor taking home that sweet Golden Plunger Award #yqr pic.twitter.com/nUTgNJj2uT 
— Christa Dao (@ChristaDao) February 20, 2017 
Off the ice, other activities included a free sleigh ride around Wascana Lake and an indoor carnival at the Conexus Arts Centre. Lineups looping at the leg for free sleigh rides @WaskimoRegina #yqr pic.twitter.com/8GTsBXTQAG
